alert.note: Alert for Hartford; Middlesex (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 6:08PM EDT until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Connecticut... Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hampden and Hartford Counties. Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Hartford and Middlesex Counties. For the Connecticut River...including Montague, Northampton, Holyoke Dam, Holyoke, Springfield, Thompsonville, Hartford, Middle Haddam... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Hartford. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Flooding affects some residential areas below Hartford through Rocky Hill, including some roadways. Upstream of Hartford, flooding is likely to affect Windsor Locks, East Windsor and Windsor. Should localized evacuations be necessary, act quickly. Know alternate routes for travel in your location should roads along the river become flooded and impassable. Further downstream flooding increases through Middletown and Portland to Old Saybrook. Some evacuations of low lying areas may be needed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM EDT Monday the stage was 7.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue rising to a crest of 23.2 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.4 feet on 04/18/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 615 AM EDT.
